channel.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
channel.description:
Hello everyone, it's Fox0wnage here again. I've been quite inactive for quite a while and my server is on the verge of being released!
Okay now for my problem. I'm on a Delta Source, and lately my Magic Book has been sticking. For example, I log on and click the Book interface and it won't work. It's stuck, until I do a magic spell such as teleport and etc. (I teleport with commands to unstick it or change my spell book with my commands). Any resolutions here? If there's any code required for you to edit for you to be able to fix this problem please notify me with a reply and I'll paste the requested code!
Thanks!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

An easier solution would be for you to please give me a sample of the code you have. If that isn’t too much trouble.

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

This:

if (playerAncientMagics == 0) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); playerAncientMagics = 0; } if (playerAncientMagics == 1 && q3 == 15) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); playerAncientMagics = 1; } if (playerAncientMagics == 2 && q10 == 15) { setSidebarInterface(6, 18787); playerAncientMagics = 2; }

Then the remainder of the tabs:

[code]setSidebarInterface(8, 5065); // friend
setSidebarInterface(9, 5715); // ignore
setSidebarInterface(10, 2449); // logout tab
setSidebarInterface(11, 19029); // wrench tab

setSidebarInterface(12, 19100); // run tab
setSidebarInterface(13, 904); // harp tab[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

setSidebarInterface(0, 2423); // attack tab setSidebarInterface(1, 3917); // skills tab setSidebarInterface(2, 638); // quest tab setSidebarInterface(3, 3213); // backpack tab setSidebarInterface(4, 1644); // items wearing tab setSidebarInterface(5, 5608); // pray tab

Indeed I do.

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

Alright here they are:

Ancients command: if(command.startsWith("ancient") && playerRights > 1){ setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // }

Code to modern spells: [I have no command set for modern spells so here’s the alter code:]

if (objectID == 6552) { if (playerAncientMagics == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); // /normal = 1151 playerAncientMagics = 0; sM("You convert to normal magic!"); } else if (playerAncientMagics == 0) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); playerAncientMagics = 1; sM("You convert to ancient magicks!"); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

Ah very good reply and probably the correct one at that. It sticks at the Ancients Spellbook as that is what I use the most. I’m guessing that if I use an alter it will trigger the case depending on my code. But my codes for the commands and the alters are the exact same. So this could be a problem. Could I see a sample to get an idea of how it should look?

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

Hmm, good idea. I’ll test this immediately and get back to you.

-----EDIT-----
I had players on my server at a point with playerrights as 0, and it occured for them as well.

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Fox0wnage, post:2, topic:347218”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=443595.msg3257258#msg3257258 date=1278212803]
Tab may be disabled.
[/quote]

Thank you for the reply, but I’m quite sure that’s not the correct resolution. As this only happens when I first log in every now and then. I use the command and then it unlocks for the rest of the time I am online. If the tab was disabled I wouldn’t be able to use it period. I’m actually beginning to think that it is happening because the commands for switching spell books begin to glitch it, these spell book commands are not available to players under the playerRights of 2. So maybe it will not mess up for anyone else.
But I shall not take that chance so if you have any more suggestions please don’t hesitate to reply.[/quote]

Make a test account with the rights of 0, see if it still is stuck on that account.

Read full topic
item.source: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!

item.title: Please read this; Topic: Spell Book; PLEASE READ!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

I Vain I:

Tab may be disabled.

Thank you for the reply, but I’m quite sure that’s not the correct resolution. As this only happens when I first log in every now and then. I use the command and then it unlocks for the rest of the time I am online. If the tab was disabled I wouldn’t be able to use it period. I’m actually beginning to think that it is happening because the commands for switching spell books begin to glitch it, these spell book commands are not available to players under the playerRights of 2. So maybe it will not mess up for anyone else.
But I shall not take that chance so if you have any more suggestions please don’t hesitate to reply.

Read full topic
